userreviews.userReview: This is the first book in the 4-book "Seasons" series. It centers around 4 families that live as neighbors in a cul-de-sac. While each family is in every book, each book focuses on one family and a particular struggle they are going through. These books are Christian fiction, and some of the best of that genre that I have read. I highly recommend the whole series.
Enjoyed this book tremendously.
Great books to read.

[ When everyone was praying for Joseph to get a heart, they were actually praying for someone else to die. How can that possibly be okay? Maybe the couple whose son died were also Christians. They didn't really have a chance to pray that THEIR son didn't die. How can god grant one prayer when it's at the expense of another's? And NOT ONE PERSON prayed for the family of the little boy who died...even though one of the women actually SAW the couple in the ER. I don't get it.  (hide spoiler)]
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE. this series. I was hooked after reading book #1. Definitely a must read.
I have read the whole series. Easy reading and Inspirational.
Great book, tissues needed for entire series.
Enjoyed this series.

Wonderful book about a small neighborhood where the families are all close friends. When tragedy strikes one of the families it is a great story of how they all come together to help each other out and bond.A true Christian story of how lives should be today - God first and then we all work together for His glory and watch things happen.
A feel good book about a group of neighbors coming together to help each other. A page turner at times and well developed characters.
took me a bit to get into the story, but very happy I listened to it until the end
[ She realizes she needs to go w/her husband and they let a young missionary stay at their house. They sold the horses to help w/Joseph's surgery costs (hide spoiler)]

Wow, 2:20 A.M.!! and I've just finished this novel. I couldn't go to bed without finishing this vivid, thought provoking, real life story. The characters in this novel are just like you and me or our neighbours down the street. This novel proves what the power of prayer can do! I can't wait to get into the sequel of this novel in the morning!! :o)From dust jacket:Tory Sullivan struggles with the demands of motherhood and her desire for a career. An aspiring writer, she wonders whether she'll ever be able to develop her talent while raising two young children. But perhaps the problem isn't a matter of time, but of Tory.Cathy Flaherty is rediscovering the grins and groans of the dating game. The spunky single mother of three teenagers, she's also learning the urgency of instilling sound values in her children as they attend public school.Sylvia Bryan is an empty-nester. Now that her children are gone, she struggles with a gnawing lack of meaning. Her husband, Harry, wants to become a medical missionary. But for Sylvia, the best part of life seems like nothing but a memory.Brenda Dodd faces an uncertain future. Her nine-year-old son is getting sicker, and there seems to be nothing they can do. It is every mother's nightmare-a child who will die unless he receives a heart transplant.As the women of Cedar Circle band together to save a dying child, they learn that each moment is precious in every season under heaven.Taking the best and worst of human circumstances-the tender moments, the laughter, the tragedies, and the triumphs."

I loved this series. Each book was good in and of itself. This book falls under "Christian Fiction," and while I believe there are elements that non-Christians or non-practicing Christians, or people who find conservative Christianity bothersome that are in this book, I do believe if you can look past that, this story is most definitely worth the read. It deals with a group of 4 women - all very different, both in the places in their life as well as their level of belief. Note - each of the 4 books in the series focus on a different neighbor. This one dealt with one neighbor who was dealing with a serious illness of her child. Not a typical reader of Christian fiction (I don't like the in your face message), this series is not something I would pick. Perhaps the reason I like this series is the very real nature that the authors deal with the relationship. It speaks in a very truthful way about friendship and love and the importance of a neighborhood. It is very similar to the style of Debbie Macomber (who I LOVE), so fans of hers will appreciate this book and/or series.

This books was really good. I had read several books in this series many years ago but missed this one somehow. I loved the series and the writings by Beverly LaHaye and Terri Blackstock. The stories in this series are about a close knit neighborhood who all know each other and share family problems and are there to help each other out in all circumstances. This book is particularly about a family whose son becomes very ill and how the family pulled together and the neighborhood came to grips with a lot of things during this time that they found inportant. It tells of how the mother in this is a church going Christian and the father is not. During this illness it brings this family closer together and shows how our God is amazing and can do all things, all we have to do is have faith. Finally the father in the story understands.A good read with several twists and turns but shows us how in this busy world today, we loose so much by not having the closeness with friends and neighbors.
This book had me in tears, but it was soo good and encouraging.

Een mooi geschreven christelijke roman wat erg makkelijk en vlot wegleest. In het begin had ik wel even moeite met alle personages die op me afkwamen. Buiten de 4 buurvrouwen en hun mannen heb je namelijk ook alle kinderen van hen die je leert kennen.In dit boek gaat het over het zoontje van Brenda. Hij is ernstig ziek en heeft dringend een nieuw hart nodig. Mooi om te lezen hoe de gemeenschap alles op alles zetten om de ziektekosten voor Joseph bij elkaar te krijgen. Wel vond ik het boek erg veel over de kerken en bidden gaan. Dat stond me op een gegeven moment wel wat tegen of ik heb de laatste tijd teveel boeken in dit genre gelezen, waardoor ik het eventjes gehad heb met het geloof. Dat kan natuurlijk ook ;-)Ik ben wel van plan om de overige delen binnenkort te gaan lezen, want ik ben benieuwd naar de verhalen over de andere buurvrouwen!

We all are in one season of life or another or passing from one to the next. This book explores a neighborhood full of different seasons. The book provided not only a good story but something to think about. Although at times it got pretty "preachy" there was truth brought out. The tragedy of a severely ill child was the unifying situation around which all the issues hung. It's true such trials make us face things we've tried to ignore or places where we need to grow.) Good message for everyone but maybe not a format that would appeal to everyone.

I enjoyed the conversations in this book, and thought it was funny that each of the four women envied the others their situation in life, not knowing the truths in those lives, and not looking for contentment in their own lives. The single lady envied the married moms and vice versa. The woman who wanted time away from her kids envied the mom with grown kids and vice versa. Most of the characters were well done, interesting people to get to "know," but the "perfect" mom felt a little stilted to me. Some of the book made me cry. A homey, comforting, comfortable read.

There are way too many characters in this book and they were not introduced well at all. The plot is a good one, but it is far to maudlin and unreal in places. The authors tried to combine the stories of all the characters, and to promote organ donation, all of which detracted from the main story about the child in need of a new heart. There was very little about the donor of the heart. Very disappointing.
I enjoyed this story despite the fact that the ending was certainly predictable. Any book written by both Beverly LaHaye and Terri Blackstock is guaranteed to be worth reading.

I enjoyed reading this book again. The neighbors are all friends and although they all struggle with their own family issues; they still reach out to help others through tough issues. In this book, a child is diagnosed with a life-threatening heart problem that will only take a miracle before time runs out.

Outstanding read. Couldn't put it down, ended up getting entire series and read them all in two weeks. I find the application of Scripture to everyday life very well handled. These books not only were a strong encouragement but challenged me in my day to day life.

This is the first book in a quartet. All four books tell the stories of four friends and neighbors learn to trust God and each other as they each handle the challenges in their lives. Each of the books tell the story of a different family. All four books are well written contemporary Christian fiction. Each book was hard to put down once I began reading it. I highly recommend this series.

Op zich is het een mooi verhaal wat inderdaad heel makkelijk leest maar ook naar mijn mening speelt het geloof en de kerk in dit boek een te grote rol. Op een gegeven moment ging ik me er echt aan irriteren, ik heb de overige delen ook al in huis (uit de bieb) maar ik weet eigenlijk niet of dat ik de overige delen nog wel wil lezen.

My review of Seasons Under HeavenIt was a very heartfelt Christian read. It kept me on my toes the whole time wondering what was going to happen next. It was a tear jerker at times, but it still was an excellent read.

My friend handed me the first 3 of this series and demanded I read them. lol. So I'm reading book one right now. It's cute. It's taking me a bit to get in to them cause there are so many characters. But it's not bad.

I don't usually read Christian Fiction because frankly they can get a little too sappy for my taste but I really enjoyed this book. It wasn't suspenseful or anything but I couldn't put it down. I even shed a few tears. Good book.

Inspirational, heartwarming story. This story explains very much how I felt going through my cancer, it was a blessing that taught me things I couldn't have learned any other way. Lord, please help me to never forget.

Four women each struggle with what is going on in this particular season of their life. The characters and their thoughts and struggles seem very real. it's a Christian novel, so there is no bad language nor sex.

description: What does a child’s life-threatening illness cost the neighbors of Cedar Circle? What joys can be hidden in life’s greatest tragedies? Behind brightly lit windows and on front porches, marriages are tested and mended, hearts broken, hopes resurrected, dreams released and reformed, values and futures shaped, and faith rekindled . . . or found for the first time. Taking the best and worst of human circumstances—the tender moments, the laughter, the tragedies, and the triumphs—Beverly LaHaye and Terri Blackstock weave from them a poignant, warmly human novel. Gently uncovering the inner struggles, stresses, and joys that surface among neighbors living on a quiet cul-de-sac, the authors show us the power of ordinary lives being knit into a strong, many-textured fabric of family and friendships.
title:
Seasons Under Heaven
      
          (Seasons #1)
